page.title: 02MOTTINGHAM VILLAGE TO SUBURB
page.content: Our grid reference has the village of Mottingham at the centre,bordered by Eltham in the North,Chislehurst in the East and Grove Park to the South West.The local government is quite complicated as some of the shops and houses pay half of their rates to Bromley and half to Greenwich, as the border runs through them.Mottingham is not mentioned in the Domesday Book but it is referred to in 862 AD in the Charter of King Elthelbert.In those days it was called Modingham.It started life as a village surrouned by farms.In 1866 the coming of the railway meant that the population grew.Later the population was increased by the building of a council estate for 12,000 people.Since then many new homes have been built.The population continues to grow.
